lines.text: two identical ~4 tall things.  This is not very crucial what it is, what its made of, exact height, etc.  What is crucial is that they're the same height.

lines.text: large NON-HYPODERMIC syringe with a two-hole rubber stopper which fits in the top (with the plunger removed), and about four feet of matching tubing.  The syringe must not be the type with the needle, but must have a fairly fine glass or plastic tip.  The wider the better, I used a ~1" wide, ~2.5" tall 50ml plastic syringe.

lines.text: Normal 2D printer with a stepper motor.  These can be distinguished from a normal one because of the lack of a grey plastic ribbion that feeds through the carriage.  I used a Lexmark Z13.  These can usually be bought at thrift stores for between two and eight dollars.
